title: Dear Andy: Going to Space Helps Us on Earth
sub_head: Walk into any hospital-patient’s room in America and see the life-saving benefit of our space program.
body:
Andy Kessler is right to ask “Dear NASA: What’s in It for Me?” (Inside View, Dec. 14), but he seems to miss how this question has been answered by the history of exploration. Columbus thought he had found a new route to Asia. Not quite. But would anyone deny that wealth and opportunities followed his discovery?
We don’t really know what space exploration might yield for humanity. We know only that we live on a tiny speck of real estate compared with the almost endless spaces and places that begin 62 miles above us. Will we find new deposits of rare-earth metals on the Moon? A better way to track asteroids coming from the direction of sun? It’s worth betting that we’ll discover a lot more than we anticipate—and a lot more than Velcro and Tang.
Ken Hoagland
Arlington, Va.
